title: Keeping language lessons ethical - are we paying too little? [italki, Verbling, etc.]

media:group.media:title: Keeping language lessons ethical - are we paying too little? [italki, Verbling, etc.]
media:group.media:description:
See italki here: https://www.mezzoguild.com/italki
Read my huge italki review here: https://www.mezzoguild.com/italki-review
I wanted to raise the question of ethical pricing for language lessons.
Are we paying people too little?
While it's a great thing to have a service where lessons from overseas contractors are incredibly cheap and competitive, I worry about the ethical implications of excessively low pricing.
What do you think?
Should there be a higher minimum cap to keep lesson pricing dignified?
